verses.kjv: And the Ziphites came unto Saul to Gibeah, saying, Doth not David hide himself in the hill of Hachilah, which is before Jeshimon?
verses.ct: The people of Ziph went to Saul at Gibeah and told him, "David is hiding on the hill of Hachilah, across from the wasteland."

verses.kjv: Then Saul arose, and went down to the wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the wilderness of Ziph.
verses.ct: So Saul set out and traveled down to the wilderness of Ziph, bringing 3,000 of Israel's best soldiers with him to search for David in that wilderness.

verses.kjv: And Saul pitched in the hill of Hachilah, which is before Jeshimon, by the way. But David abode in the wilderness, and he saw that Saul came after him into the wilderness.
verses.ct: Saul set up camp on the hill of Hachilah, across from the wasteland, along the road. David was staying in the wilderness, and when he learned that Saul had followed him there,

verses.kjv: David therefore sent out spies, and understood that Saul was come in very deed.
verses.ct: he sent out scouts and confirmed that Saul had definitely arrived.

verses.kjv: And David arose, and came to the place where Saul had pitched: and David beheld the place where Saul lay, and Abner the son of Ner, the captain of his host: and Saul lay in the trench, and the people pitched round about him.
verses.ct: David got up and went to the place where Saul had made camp. He saw where Saul was sleeping, along with Abner son of Ner, the commander of his army. Saul was lying in the center of the camp, with his troops camped all around him.

verses.kjv: Then answered David and said to Ahimelech the Hittite, and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, brother to Joab, saying, Who will go down with me to Saul to the camp? And Abishai said, I will go down with thee.
verses.ct: David spoke to Ahimelech the Hittite and to Abishai son of Zeruiah, Joab's brother, asking, "Who will come down into Saul's camp with me?" Abishai replied, "I'll go with you."

verses.kjv: So David and Abishai came to the people by night: and, behold, Saul lay sleeping within the trench, and his spear stuck in the ground at his bolster: but Abner and the people lay round about him.
verses.ct: So David and Abishai crept into the camp at night. There was Saul, sound asleep in the middle of the camp, with his spear stuck in the ground near his head. Abner and the soldiers were sleeping all around him.

verses.kjv: Then said Abishai to David, God hath delivered thine enemy into thine hand this day: now therefore let me smite him, I pray thee, with the spear even to the earth at once, and I will not smite him the second time.
verses.ct: Abishai whispered to David, "God has handed your enemy over to you today. Let me pin him to the ground with one thrust of the spear — I won't need a second one."

verses.kjv: And David said to Abishai, Destroy him not: for who can stretch forth his hand against the LORD’s anointed, and be guiltless?
verses.ct: But David told Abishai, "Don't kill him! No one can raise a hand against the LORD's anointed and remain innocent."

verses.kjv: David said furthermore, As the LORD liveth, the LORD shall smite him; or his day shall come to die; or he shall descend into battle, and perish.
verses.ct: David continued, "As surely as the LORD lives, the LORD himself will strike him down — either his time will come and he'll die naturally, or he'll go into battle and be killed.

verses.kjv: The LORD forbid that I should stretch forth mine hand against the LORD’s anointed: but, I pray thee, take thou now the spear that is at his bolster, and the cruse of water, and let us go.
verses.ct: May the LORD keep me from ever raising my hand against his anointed one. But grab the spear by his head and the water jug, and let's get out of here."

verses.kjv: So David took the spear and the cruse of water from Saul’s bolster; and they gat them away, and no man saw it, nor knew it, neither awaked: for they were all asleep; because a deep sleep from the LORD was fallen upon them.
verses.ct: So David took the spear and the water jug from beside Saul's head, and the two of them slipped away. No one saw them, no one noticed, and no one woke up, because the LORD had put them all into a deep sleep.

verses.kjv: Then David went over to the other side, and stood on the top of an hill afar off; a great space being between them:
verses.ct: Then David crossed over to the other side and stood on top of a distant hill, with a wide gap between them.

verses.kjv: And David cried to the people, and to Abner the son of Ner, saying, Answerest thou not, Abner? Then Abner answered and said, Who art thou that criest to the king?
verses.ct: David shouted down to the troops and to Abner son of Ner, "Aren't you going to answer me, Abner?" Abner called back, "Who are you, shouting at the king?"

verses.kjv: And David said to Abner, Art not thou a valiant man? and who is like to thee in Israel? wherefore then hast thou not kept thy lord the king? for there came one of the people in to destroy the king thy lord.
verses.ct: David replied, "Aren't you supposed to be a brave warrior? Isn't there anyone in Israel like you? Then why didn't you protect your master the king? Someone came into the camp to kill your master the king!

verses.kjv: This thing is not good that thou hast done. As the LORD liveth, ye are worthy to die, because ye have not kept your master, the LORD’s anointed. And now see where the king’s spear is, and the cruse of water that was at his bolster.
verses.ct: What you've done is inexcusable. As surely as the LORD lives, you all deserve death because you failed to guard your master, the LORD's anointed. Now look around — where is the king's spear? Where is the water jug that was beside his head?"

verses.kjv: And Saul knew David’s voice, and said, Is this thy voice, my son David? And David said, It is my voice, my lord, O king.
verses.ct: Saul recognized David's voice and called out, "Is that your voice, my son David?" David answered, "It is, my lord the king."

verses.kjv: And he said, Wherefore doth my lord thus pursue after his servant? for what have I done? or what evil is in mine hand?
verses.ct: Then he asked, "Why is my lord chasing his own servant? What have I done? What crime am I guilty of?

verses.kjv: Now therefore, I pray thee, let my lord the king hear the words of his servant. If the LORD have stirred thee up against me, let him accept an offering: but if they be the children of men, cursed be they before the LORD; for they have driven me out this day from abiding in the inheritance of the LORD, saying, Go, serve other gods.
verses.ct: Please, my lord the king, listen to what your servant has to say. If the LORD has turned you against me, then may he accept an offering from you. But if people are responsible for this, may they be cursed in the LORD's presence, because they have driven me away from living in the land the LORD gave his people, basically telling me, 'Go worship other gods.'

verses.kjv: Now therefore, let not my blood fall to the earth before the face of the LORD: for the king of Israel is come out to seek a flea, as when one doth hunt a partridge in the mountains.
verses.ct: So please, don't let my blood be spilled far from the LORD's presence. The king of Israel has come out hunting for a single flea — like someone chasing a partridge through the mountains."

verses.kjv: Then said Saul, I have sinned: return, my son David: for I will no more do thee harm, because my soul was precious in thine eyes this day: behold, I have played the fool, and have erred exceedingly.
verses.ct: Saul responded, "I have sinned. Come back, my son David. I won't try to harm you again, because you valued my life today. I've been a fool and made a terrible mistake."

verses.kjv: And David answered and said, Behold the king’s spear! and let one of the young men come over and fetch it.
verses.ct: David called back, "Here is the king's spear! Send one of your young men over to get it.

verses.kjv: The LORD render to every man his righteousness and his faithfulness; for the LORD delivered thee into my hand to day, but I would not stretch forth mine hand against the LORD’s anointed.
verses.ct: The LORD rewards everyone according to their righteousness and faithfulness. The LORD handed you over to me today, but I refused to raise my hand against the LORD's anointed.

verses.kjv: And, behold, as thy life was much set by this day in mine eyes, so let my life be much set by in the eyes of the LORD, and let him deliver me out of all tribulation.
verses.ct: Just as I valued your life greatly today, may the LORD value my life in the same way and rescue me from every trouble."

verses.kjv: Then Saul said to David, Blessed be thou, my son David: thou shalt both do great things, and also shalt still prevail. So David went on his way, and Saul returned to his place.
verses.ct: Then Saul said to David, "May you be blessed, my son David. You will accomplish great things and will surely succeed." So David went on his way, and Saul returned home.
